Description:
Dual Occ or Federation Family Favourite
A splendid display of Federation era sophistication, this three bedroom home puts families at the heart of a great lifestyle locale. Behind its impeccable façade lies a grandly proportioned home where lofty ornate ceiling, deep cornices and fretwork adorn a wide hallway. A lounge made private with sliding doors opens to an expansive family living and dining, spotless timber St George kitchen and covered alfresco overseeing an easy-care north-facing rear to deliver effortless family entertaining. Accommodation comprises three lavish bedrooms, two with fireplaces, plus central bathroom, laundry incorporating an additional shower, ducted heating, air-conditioner, alarm and garage via ROW. This grand home puts bustling Sydney Road shopping and trams, Moreland Station and schools at your fingertips.
Insights: 173 Moreland Road, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Luxury, Space & Design!
With sophistication oozing at every turn, be impressed by this architecturally designed townhouse with 3 bedrooms + study & 2 bathrooms.
Boasting an expansive, 'larger than most' open plan living/dining area with polished hard wood floors & split system. Impressive kitchen with immaculate finishes including waterfall, Caesar stone island bench, sleek, glass splashback and s/steel Bosch appliances. Glass sliding doors lead seamlessly to large, undercover balcony. 3 large bedrooms all with BIRs, main with full ensuite, additional study or potential for 4th bedroom.
Exceptional design throughout with additional features; remote garage with stacker, high ceilings, wall heaters & Euro laundry.
City tram at your door step, walking distance to Moreland station & Merri Creek Trail. Enjoy easy access to Sydney Road, Lygon Street cafÃ©s, restaurants & bars.
Architecturally designed by Billy Kavellaris, this one is sure to impress!
Insights: 6/11 Nicholson Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Veiled Victorian with Perfect Potential!
Beyond the veneer of its clad facade, this proud Victorian occupies a substantial block of land providing a lifestyle of immediate comfort and enviable convenience, along with a multitude of options to renovate and extend, rebuild or possibly redevelop (STCA). Meticulously maintained by the one family for the past 50 years, the home's impeccable interior comprises an inviting entrance hallway, two genuinely large bedrooms and updated bathroom. Add to this a separate dining room (or third bedroom) and wide central lounge leading through to the kitchen/meals area complete with stone benchtops, solid timber cabinetry and stainless steel cooking appliances. Other features include gas heating and split-system air conditioning, high ceilings, internal laundry, plus front off-street parking space and large backyard garden with established fruit trees and rear ROW highlighting the property's generous dimensions and untapped future potential. Close proximity to the best of Coburg, it's walking distance to Coburg Station, Sydney Road trams, cafes and restaurants, boutique shops and major supermarkets, as well as easy access to local parks and schools.
Insights: 21 Nelson Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Low maintenance living at its best
Providing a perfect mix of retro flair and modern comfort, this single level villa
is a secluded surprise set toward the rear of a neat development and only
minutes from Moreland Station and bustling Sydney Road.
Rich timber floorboards showcase throughout its warm and tasteful interior
that radiates with natural light. The open plan floorplan includes a
contemporary kitchen equipped with stainless steel appliances and ample
storage. The large master bedroom includes built in robes and access to a
stylish bathroom/laundry. Theres also the added appeal of a low maintenance
courtyard perfect entertaining.
Extra modern comforts also include split system heating/cooling throughout,
quality window furnishings and a car space on title. Positioned minutes from
public transport, local cafes, boutique shopping not mention its swift commute
to the CBD!
Insights: 6/160 Reynard Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Light and Style with Indoor/Outdoor Space
With its distinctive seventies' architecture, quality enhancements throughout and private courtyard surprise, this two-storey townhouse (one of only five) is a must-see for professionals and investors alike. Every room bathed in natural light, the home's impeccable interior comprises two large bedrooms (both with vaulted ceilings and full-width robes), spotless central bathroom and separate laundry/WC. Add to this a study alcove with built-in workstation, lounge and separate dining area accompanied by an updated kitchen with dishwasher. Double-glazed windows throughout, the home also includes split-system heating and cooling, polished concrete floors, plus a wonderfully spacious north-facing courtyard garden with high fences for added privacy and handy storage shed, as well as an undercover parking space. Walking distance to Coburg Station and renowned shopping precinct, it's also close to parks and schools, Sydney Road cafes and restaurants, trams to university/hospital precincts as well as easy access to Citylink.
Insights: 5/22 Loch Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Timeless Terrace in the Heart of Cosmopolitan Coburg
In a prime position with the buzz of Sydney Road at the end of the street, this single-front Victorian terrace provides a welcoming environment of quality and privacy with its open-design interior and abundance of natural light throughout. Ready to simply move and enjoy, the home's pristine interior showcases two generous bedrooms (both with built-in robes) and contemporary-style bathroom with floor-to-ceiling tiles. Add to this a central lounge flowing through to the dining/living area and updated kitchen with stainless steel cooking appliances and Bosch dishwasher. Along with gas heating and additional wood heater, the home also features high ornate ceilings and solid hardwood floors, full-size laundry, plus a sunny north-facing backyard with extensive paving, handy storage shed and access to the rear ROW. An outstanding location with the best of Coburg at your fingertips, it's walking distance to trams, popular cafes and endless eateries, close to local schools, Coburg Station and the area's renowned retail precinct.
Insights: 27 Sargood Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Californian with a Gorgeous Garden Surprise
In a blissfully quiet neighbourhood with easy access to the best of Coburg, this attractive period home provides a family environment of immediate enjoyment along with exciting options to enhance and expand in the future (STCA). Beyond the captivating facade complete with decked verandah, the home's inviting interior comprises three large bedrooms (master with built-in robes) and updated central bathroom. Add to this a separate lounge and light-filled open family/meals area accompanied by a neat kitchen complete with dishwasher and Smeg oven. Ducted heating and split-system air conditioning, towering ceilings, solid timber floors and second WC all add to the appeal, plumped outdoor bath, plus a large country-style north-facing backyard with undercover decking, extensive landscaping, working veggie patch and handy workshop/storeroom. Potential to add parking. Moments from the open spaces of Anderson Reserve with its brand-new playground, it also offers easy access to the area's popular primary schools (Coburg West and St Fidelis), Coburg's renowned shopping precinct and Sydney Road cafes, as well as trains and trams to the CBD.
Insights: 50 Marks Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
The Land Of Opportunity
Situated in the heart of Coburg, in one of our most tightly held pockets, this rare opportunity to purchase a vacant parcel of land offers inspiration seldom found. With an East/West orientation and offering both street and bluestone rear access, this centrally located allotment measuring approx. 400m2 (11.4m frontage and 34.3m depth), provides the perfect foundation for you to build your ideal family home or potential development site (STCA). Nestled in this prized location, a short walk to cosmopolitan Sydney Road shopping and cafes, St Bernard's and Coburg Primary Schools, Merri Creek parklands and trails, and a choice of city-bound tramlines.
Insights: 27 Fowler Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Opportunity awaits
An excellent opportunity has presented itself. Are you ready? This property offers an exquisite layout and well-designed open plan living and kitchen area, along with an abundance of natural light that bathes the home. Whether you're looking for your first home, downsize or rewarding investment this opportunity is not to be missed.
Two generously sized bedrooms both with floor to ceiling windows, carpet underfoot and master with ensuite. Storage is at a premium with large cupboards located throughout the apartment. Open plan living and kitchen area complemented by stainless steel appliances, dishwasher and breakfast bench, adjoining to your own private balcony with great sun exposure and access via master bedroom. Boasting a central bathroom equipped with European laundry. With luxury features such as split system A/C, wall heaters in each bedroom and tiles throughout there is no going past this apartment when looking for exceptional value. A secure car space just adds to the appeal of this property.
A short walk will have you at Sydney Road or Bell Street where you will find an abundance of restaurants, cafes and shops. Transport options are endless with tram routes 19 and 1 only a short distance away. The train is only a moment away with Coburg station servicing the Upfield line ensuring you can get to CBD with minimum fuss. For those who enjoy the great outdoors you will have Merri Creek Trail and Bridges Reserve a stone's throw away.
Insights: 101/5 Wardens Walk, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 73 other 2 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Here's Where It Happens
Hitting the market for the first time in almost two thirds of a century this comfortable, freestanding, three bedroom home is advantageously positioned near a wide selection of amenities, approximately 7 kilometres from the CBD. Enter to discover high ceilings and spaces including an open living and dining domain, adjoining kitchen/meals and big bedrooms with proportions rarely seen today. Centrally positioned, the bathroom has a bath and separate shower and among appealing further inclusions the home offers heating, cooling and a carport. There's plenty of room at the rear too, including a backyard with fruit trees and a storage shed. Buzzing Sydney Road, multiple tram lines, St Bernard's Primary, Antonine College, Moreland Primary, Coburg High School, Coburg City Oval and Merri Creek are all nearby, and the position is south of Bell Street, proving it hard to resist. Consider investing, renovating or building new (subject to council approval) to make the most of prime potential.
Insights: 68 Barrow Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Potential Packed And Positioned To Please
In its heyday a haven for family and friends, this two bedroom Californian Bungalow in a serene cul-de-sac location offers astute buyers a myriad of options. Restore the existing home to its former glory, build your state-of-the-art family sanctuary or explore options for a stunning redevelopment on this generous 622m2 approx. allotment (STCA). The existing floorplan with its generous proportions and trademark lofty ceilings features expansive lounge and dining which can be converted to a third bedroom, spacious eat-in kitchen with original cabinetry and 700mm gas range, sunroom, central bathroom, laundry incorporating a second shower and extensive rear gardens with sheds. Moments to schools, Merri Creek parklands, Nicholson Street trams, Coburg Station and Sydney Road, it promises a potential packed future and a lifestyle of enviable convenience.
Insights: 45 Patterson Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Easy-Living Style with Light and Location
Tucked away in a leafy streetscape with close proximity to the best of Cosmopolitan Coburg, this attractive townhouse delivers a terrific low-maintenance lifestyle with its quality features, abundance of natural light and impressive dimensions both inside and out. With its own street frontage and no shared land, the home's impeccable interior comprises three generous upstairs bedrooms (all with built-in robes), two-way central bathroom and two separate WCs (one on each level). The light-filled front lounge leads through to an open-plan living/meals area accompanied by a spotless kitchen complete with dishwasher and stainless steel cooking appliances. Other highlights of the home include ducted heating and evaporative cooling, full-size laundry and under-stair storeroom, plus a surprisingly large backyard with extensive paving, gazebo and secure carport. Moments from Merri Creek trails and acres of parkland, it also offers easy access to local cafes and schools, shops and supermarkets, an endless array of restaurants as well as a choice of tramlines to university/hospital precincts and the CBD.
Insights: 76 Glengyle Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Authentic Period Warmth, Expertly Extended For Family Living
This handsome California Bungalow, renovated and extended in high-ceilinged style, combines 1920s style with all the comforts of modern family living. Set on a low-maintenance garden block, with electric security gates and entry from a wide verandah, the residence offers a functional floor plan comprising three bedrooms (BIRs) and two stylish bathrooms with timber cabinetry; an elegant central sitting room with OFP; well-equipped kitchen (granite benches, custom cabinetry) open to an expansive informal living/dining room flowing through French doors to a deck and private courtyard; plus separate laundry. Close to all public transport options, schools, parks and freeway access, this delightful light-filled home includes a garage/workshop, carport and ample off-street parking, and features polished Baltic and hardwood floors, ducted heating, evaporative/split-system a/c and alarm system.

Description:
Spacious Style, Enviable Lifestyle
Enjoy an easy care indoor-outdoor lifestyle with this stylish two bedroom unit, pristinely maintained and notable for its spacious interiors and expansive courtyard surrounds. The ideal first home, downsizer or investment opportunity, the low-maintenance lifestyle appeal of this unit is perfectly matched by its convenient location, near Melville Road trams, local shopping, O'Heas bakery, Coburg Farmer's Market, schools, buses and more. Federation inspired, this property features relaxed indoor-outdoor living where generous lounge and dining complemented by well-ordered kitchen that includes ample storage, counterspace and a dishwasher, open to a spacious courtyard garden. Double bedrooms with robes, master with WIR share a stylish bathroom, that together with heating/cooling, ceiling fans, spacious laundry, single garage with remote plus OSP complete this appealing home.

Description:
Haven in Great Locale
Get set for something special with this larger than normal three bedroom townhouse, where a convenient location and a large courtyard will capture your attention. With the potential for a front garden and gated secure parking along with a single car garage this is one property not to be missed.
Floorboards greet you upon entry, formal living area adjoining to the generous size open plan kitchen and dining area with ample bench space, dishwasher and gas cooktop for that aspiring MasterChef. Flowing on through to your own private courtyard perfect for entertaining family and friends. Upstairs you have three bedrooms all with carpet underfoot, master with ensuite and built in robes.
Centralised bathroom service upstairs with an additional powder room downstairs, separate laundry complimented by a security alarm and ducted heating.
Enviable urban ease, it's walking distance to Batman Station and Sydney Road trams, also close to primary and secondary schools, Coburg Lake Reserve as well as popular cafes and vibrant shopping precincts.

Description:
Executive Perfection in the Heart of Coburg
Uncompromised quality and meticulous attention to detail, this extraordinary townhouse is in a class of its own thanks to its design excellence, premium finishes throughout and enviably central position well south of Bell Street. Beyond the stunning facade with distinctive recycled brickwork, the home's lavish interior showcases three spacious bedrooms (all with fitted robes), two luxurious ensuites and equally-impressive main bathroom - all with floor-to-ceiling tiles and distinctive timber or brick feature walls. Bathed in natural light, the versatile open-plan living/dining area is complemented by a gourmet Bosch-equipped kitchen and further enhanced by double sliding doors revealing a wide north-facing balcony. High square-set ceilings throughout, this remarkable residence also boasts a full-size laundry and guest powder room (fourth WC), solid hardwood floors and on-trend matt black fittings, heating and cooling, ducted vacuum, stone benchtops and soft-close cabinetry throughout, plus a decked rear courtyard, internally-accessed garage (r/c) and additional driveway parking space. The best of Coburg at your fingertips, it's walking distance to Coburg Station, Sydney Road trams, cafes and restaurants, boutique shops and major supermarkets, as well as easy access to local parks and schools. Absolute luxury in a perfect position!

Description:
Lock It In
Gleaming and graced with spacious open design, this elevated three bedroom, two bathroom home is close to everything. Distinct yet cleverly joined by bi-folds, the living domain adjoins a flowing kitchen and dining featuring a gas log fire, fan forced oven, 90cm gas cooktop and Bosch dishwasher. A versatile covered outdoor area is ready for entertainers to make it their own and there's a vegie patch for green thumbs. Each bedroom hosts a walk-in or built-in robe and bathrooms include an ensuite. Solar panels, security cameras, ducted heating, sheds, water tanks and a direct entry automatic garage also feature. Trains, trams, Lake Reserve, schools and buzzing Sydney Road are nearby.
Insights: 23 Stock Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Californian Classic with Rewarding Renovation Potential
Occupying a substantial block of land, this attractive period home is a must-see for home buyers and investors alike providing a lifestyle of immediate function and future excellence - just north of Brunswick's border in Coburg's most sought-after neighbourhood. Well-presented throughout, the home's current floorplan comprises a central hallway accessing three generous bedrooms and central bathroom. Add to this a front lounge and adjoining dining room, functional kitchen, as well as a study/sunroom and large enclosed back verandah. Step outside to discover a sizeable north-facing backyard complete with large workshop/storeroom and plenty of room to extend (STCA). Exceptional inner-urban convenience, it's walking distance to Moreland Station and a choice of tram lines, primary and secondary schools, Merri Creek trails and parkland, as well as easy access to Sydney Road/Lygon Street eateries and renowned retail precincts.
Land: 40.23 x 11.46m = 461sqm Approximately

Description:
Character, Position and Promise
Brimming with promise this four bedroom Art Deco retains details of its era and opens up enticing possibilities on generous land of approximately 603m2. In addition to a living room there's a central kitchen/meals, versatile tiled area that would make a handy study, large covered outdoor area for alfresco dining and a deep rear lawn that's practically a blank canvas. High ceilings with decorative details add character, most bedrooms are large and the bathroom is in a central position. A side driveway takes care of parking and there's a big workshop and storage area, but the greatest potential lies in the range of opportunities presented to inspired buyers: consider renovating, extending, building new or further developing the site (subject to council approval). There's plenty to recommend the position: in a cul-de-sac near a great range of transport including trains, trams and buses, it's also close to Anderson Reserve, schools and the many shops, cafes and restaurants of cosmopolitan Sydney Road.
Insights: 1 Florence Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
TIMELESS ELEGANCE
Immaculately appointed with rich period features throughout, this superb family home has nothing left to do, just move in and enjoy. This versatile floor plan includes three oversized bedrooms (master with full ensuite), gourmet kitchen with stainless steel benchtop and splashback and a superb chef's oven. Add to this formal lounge and dining room leading via French doors onto beautifully manicured back garden. Exquisite features include wood panelling, ornate fireplace, hardwood floors and lead lighting, plus ducted heating/cooling. Side drive to awesome double storey garage/self-contained bungalow/teenagers retreat with bathroom and its own private entry. In a highly sought after location, only 500m (approx.) to Moreland station, bus at your door step and just over 7km to CBD. Fantastic primary and secondary schools in the area. Land size 465sqm approx.
Insights: 309 Moreland Road, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
The versatile entertainer
This two bedroom cream clinker, spacious with Art Deco detail proves the most versatile of homes with its studios offering an additional two bedrooms. But more than that, this home's main drawcard is its effortless entertaining. A gourmet CaesarStone kitchen with 900mm Falcon range is flanked by L-shaped lounge and dining, and lavish covered alfresco complete with cafe curtains, spa, heating and fans offering all-weather entertaining. North facing rear gardens extend outdoor entertaining, while stacker doors between lounge and dining means the home is as open or private as you want. Add to this a bright bathroom, hardwood floors, OFP, heating/cooling, solar panels, water tank, ample storage plus OSP in a serene cul-de-sac near Moreland Station, Sydney Road, parks and schools.
Insights: 28 Hall Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.
